title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Energy
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Energy 

Performance of Buildings) Regulations 2022. 

Definitions
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (energy performance buildings) regulation 2022 definition

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

“Directive” means Directive 2010/31/EU of the European Parliament and of 
the Council of 19 May 20101 on the energy performance of buildings, as 
amended by Directive (EU) 2018/844 of the European Parliament and of the 
Council of 30 May 20182 amending Directive 2010/31/EU on the energy 
performance of buildings and Directive 2012/27/EU on energy efficiency; 

“SEAI” means the Sustainable Energy Authority of Ireland. 

(2) A word or expression used in these Regulations and which is also used 
in the Directive has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same meaning in 
these Regulations as it has in that Directive. 

Advice on heating systems
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - directive mean directive 2010 31 eu european parliament council 19 may 20101 energy performance building amended directive (eu) 2018 844 european parliament council 30 may 20182 amending directive 2010 31 eu energy performance building directive 2012 27 eu energy efficiency seai mean sustainable energy authority ireland (2) word expression used regulation also used directive unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation directive advice heating system

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 3. (1) The SEAI shall provide advice to users concerning the replacement
text_raw:
3. (1) The SEAI shall provide advice to users concerning the replacement 
of heat generators, other modifications to the heating system or to the system 
for combined space heating and ventilation and alternative solutions to assess 
the efficiency and appropriate size of those systems. 

(2) Prior to the application of the alternative measures mentioned in 
paragraph (1), the SEAI shall document the equivalence of the impact of those 
measures to the impact of the alternative measures mentioned in Regulation 6. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 29th July, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [376] 3 

Advice on air-conditioning systems

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 4. (1) The SEAI shall provide advice to users concerning the replacement
text_raw:
4. (1) The SEAI shall provide advice to users concerning the replacement 
of air-conditioning systems or systems for combined air-conditioning and 
ventilation, other modifications to the air-conditioning system or system for 
combined air-conditioning and ventilation and alternative solutions to assess 
the efficiency and appropriate size of those systems. 

(2) Prior to the application of the alternative measures mentioned in 
paragraph (1), the SEAI shall document the equivalence of the impact those 
measures to the impact of the alternative measures mentioned in Regulation 7. 

Documentation on equivalence

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 5. (1) The documentation prepared by the SEAI under paragraph (2) of
text_raw:
5. (1) The documentation prepared by the SEAI under paragraph (2) of 

Regulation 3 or 4 shall – 

(a) 

be provided to the Minister, in accordance with the applicable 
planning and reporting obligations, for submission to the 
European Commission prior to the application of the alternative 
measures mentioned in paragraph (1) of Regulations 3 and 4, 
and 

(b) have had regard to the equivalent measures and exemptions 
contained in Article 14 or 15, as the case may be, of the 
Directive. 

Impact of advice: heating systems

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 6. (1) The overall impact of the advice provided by the SEAI under
text_raw:
6. (1) The overall impact of the advice provided by the SEAI under 
Regulation 3 shall seek to achieve the equivalent effect of regular inspections 
of the accessible parts of heating systems or of systems for combined space 
heating and ventilation, with an effective rated output of over 70 kW, such as 
the heat generator, control system and circulation pump(s) used for heating 
buildings were to be established. 

(2) The inspections, referred to in paragraph (1), would include an 
assessment of the efficiency and sizing of the heat generator compared with the 
heating requirements of the building and, where relevant, consider the 
capabilities of the heating system or of the system for combined space heating 
and ventilation to optimise its performance under typical or average operating 
conditions. 

Impact of advice: air-conditioning systems
text_norm: 6 (1) overall impact advice provided seai regulation 3 shall seek achieve equivalent effect regular inspection accessible part heating system system combined space heating ventilation effective rated output 70 kw heat generator control system circulation pump(s) used heating building established (2) inspection referred paragraph (1) would include assessment efficiency sizing heat generator compared heating requirement building relevant consider capability heating system system combined space heating ventilation optimise performance typical average operating condition impact advice air-conditioning system

title: the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of
heading: 7. (1) The overall impact of the advice provided by the SEAI under
text_raw:
7. (1) The overall impact of the advice provided by the SEAI under 
Regulation 4 shall seek to achieve the effect equivalent of regular inspections 
of the accessible parts of air-conditioning systems or of systems for combined 
air-conditioning and ventilation, with an effective rated output of over 70 kW. 

(2) The inspections, referred to in paragraph (1), would include an 
assessment of the efficiency and sizing of the air-conditioning system 
compared with the cooling requirements of the building and, where relevant, 

 
 
 
 
 4 [376] 

consider the capabilities of the air conditioning system or of the system for 
combined air-conditioning and ventilation to optimise its performance under 
typical or average operating conditions. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

18 July, 2022. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for the Environment, 
Climate and Communications. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [376] 5
